item.title: EverSiege: Untold Ages delayed to March 26
item.content:encoded:
• PC

No longer due out on February 3.

Publisher Dear Villagers and developer Tindalos Interactive have delayed roguelite action strategy game EverSiege: Untold Ages from its previously planned February 3 release date to March 26. It will be available for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store for $19.99.

The March 26 release will mark the complete release, which will include the full roster of Wargears, troops, and spells, all enemy factions, three-players cooperative gameplay, and the age system with procedurally generated maps.

Here is an overview of the game, via Dear Villagers:

About

Two centuries after the world fell, Bastion still stands.

Once banished by the ancient gods, you are summoned to break the EVERSIEGE.

Each run forces hard choices—what to rebuild, what to spare, which power to pursue.

Wield legendary weapons, pair them with elemental Essences, and craft your playstyle through evolving challenges. Rebuild Bastion, manage your resources, and hold the line against relentless hordes while striking deep into enemy territory.

Defend Bastion. Break the everSiege.

Key Features

  • Defend, Rebuild, and Reclaim
    • Bastion is your last stronghold, and every decision counts.
    • Gather resources, reinforce your defenses, and make tactical calls in real time as hordes tighten their grip.
    • Will you invest in towers, push the front lines, or unlock ancient shrines? Bastion is more than a refuge, it’s a weapon. Survive the siege, reclaim the land, and face the Evil master behind it all.
  • Combine Wargears and Essences
    • Shape your playstyle by combining weapons and elemental Essences.
    • Whether you wield swift daggers, a crushing axe, or a precise longbow, each Wargear unlocks a unique approach to combat. Pair it with fire, ice, lightning… Essence to craft your build.
    • Mix, match, and experiment—every synergy unlocks new tactics, and the possibilities are almost endless.
  • Each Run is a New Adventure
    • You might hold your victory now, but the evil is rooting far back. Backtrack through time to defeat all versions of the Evil Master.
    • But the corridors of time are unpredictable, as every leap back reveals an altered and more dangerous version of reality.
    • Survive, upgrade, and adapt. Your choices shape every run, unlocking lasting power through evolving challenges and ever-changing battlegrounds.

item.title: Crisol: Theater of Idols launches February 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

First-person horror action adventure game dated.

First-person horror action adventure game Crisol: Theater of Idols will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on February 10 for $17.99, publisher Blumhouse Games and developer Vermila announced. A PC demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via Blumhouse Games:

About

Crisol: Theater of Idols is a gripping first-person horror / action adventure set in the haunting world of Hispania, a nightmarish reimagining of Spain.

Playing as Gabriel, a soldier who can use his own blood as a deadly weapon, you endeavor on a journey to uncover the mysterious disappearance of the Sun God.

Key Features

  • Explore the Cursed Island of Tormentosa – Uncover the chilling history and twisted folklore of Tormentosa, a beautiful but malevolent island. Traverse eerie landscapes, crumbling grand ruins, and labyrinthine streets as you peel back the layers of cults and blood sacrifice.
  • Blood is Your Weapon—and Your Curse – Blood is both your lifeline and your ammunition. Wield this new-found power against terrifying enemies and solve intricate puzzles, but beware: every shot drains your life. Choose wisely—survival hinges on your ability to balance life and death.
  • Manage Your Powers and Weapons – Upgrading the powers that leverage the lethality of blood allows you to deal more damage, fight for longer, and gain bonuses in combat. Navigate myriad weapon options for the right scenario and improve them through coins found in your exploration of Tormentosa.
  • A Story Rooted in Horror and History – Hispania’s disturbing fusion of historical events, folklore, and religious undertones creates a uniquely horrifying world. Face off against staggering statues brought to life and unravel a dark narrative that blurs the line between reality and nightmare.

Prepare to sacrifice everything. How much blood will you shed to uncover the truth?

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors demo launches February 23 for Xbox Series, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox Series

New video introduces "Turboturn" and card customization.

poncle will release a demo for roguelite deckbuilder Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors for Xbox Series and PC via Steam on February 23, the developer announced.

The company also released the first in a new video series dubbed, “Let’s Explore Vampire Crawlers.” Episode one dives into the following two key mechanics:

  • The Turboturn! – Turn-based combat without the wait. In Vampire Crawlers, you don’t have to pause for animations to complete before triggering your next move. The game intelligently stacks and executes your ability inputs with precision, allowing you to play at your own chaotic pace. It turns tactical combat into a fast, engaging, and visually rewarding experience.
  • Card Customization! – Discover endless ways to play your cards. Gems allow you to customize your cards with a variety of effects, ranging from raw damage multipliers to full Weapon Evolutions. Whether you want a simple power boost or deep strategic planning, Gems give every player the tools to create game-breaking combos.

Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC via Steam and Microsoft Store, iOS, and Android in early to mid 2026.

Watch the new video below.

item.title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct set for January 25
item.content:encoded:
• Nintendo

Another look ahead of April 3 premiere.

Nintendo will host The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct on January 25 at 6:00 a.m. PT / 9:00 a.m. ET / 23:00 JST, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (America, Europe, Japan).

The broadcast will feature an exclusive look at The Super Mario Galaxy Movie.

The Super Mario Galaxy Movie will premiere on April 3, 2026 in the United States and many additional markets globally, with select territories releasing throughout the month of April.
